results.title: The Samurai. Volume 5 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Senkoska Film Company, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Sadao Funatoko
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, revolves around the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is hunting down enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This disc, Volume five, consists of three episodes. “Secret mission to Kyoto”: When a high-ranking minister, Lord Sadanobu, plans a trip to Kyoto, he has a secret mission planned - to foil a conspiracy against the government. Numerous Iga ninja are hired to assassinate Sadanobu before he reaches his destination, led by the fanatical Momocki Genkuro. Against his wishes, Shintaro agrees to protect Sadanobu on his treacherous journey. “Rocket attack”: The Iga ninjas continue their cunning assaults on Lord Sadanobu and his party. Shintaro remains instrumental in outwitting them. “The Bribe”: As Sadonubo continues his journey, the ninjas plan to kill him whilst he rests at a remote country inn. An impoverished woman is bribed into assisting them. Two sets of ninjas engage in a furious showdown. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Senkosha, Toshio Kobayashi and Toru Toyama
results.brief_description: Three episodes from the classic 60’s television series. Shintaro and Tombie, “the Mist” travel feudal Japan, fighting evil, and protecting the innocent. “Living Death”: Shintaro and his followers are protecting the Prince from the Death Ninja. Disguised as an old man the Death Ninja breaks through their defence. Tombei is captured and Shintaro faces his enemy in a fight to the death. “The Spider”: Shintaro is sent to recover gold hidden in Koga country and is lured into a trap by a female Ninja. “Musai’s curse”: The Fuma Ninja have returned to reclaim their lands and the Fire Dragon Mirror in the castle. A deadly curse is placed on the Lord of the castle and his daughter is taken hostage. Who ya gonna call?

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 1
results.creator_credit: Senkosha, Toshio Kobayashi and Toru Toyama
results.brief_description: Three episodes from the classic 60’s television series. Shintaro and Tombie, “the Mist”, travel feudal Japan battling the evil Kongo of Koga, the dreaded Fuma Ninja and the Phantom Ninja. Shintaro, the great Samurai master, unleashes an exciting blend of action, magic and swordsmanship to overcome the forces of darkness. “The Poison Dart”: Kongo devises a clever plan to kill Shintaro. During a fierce battle Shintaro is struck by a poison dart. Kongo and his evil Ninja appear to have won. Revenge: Friends of Shintaro have now given up hope. Is he really dead? Will his revenge be successful against Kongo? “The Master Ninja”: The Phantom Ninja are tricked into coming to the Shogun’s palace by Kongo, who then recruits them for his evil purposes.

results.title: The Samurai
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Australia-Japan Foundation, Christopher McCullough and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
This program examines the fate of the Samurai (warrior class) when Japan modernised at the turn of the century. Keith Adam shows the making of one of the countless popular movies which recreates the Samurai and their era and postulates that the Samurai live on not only in films but also in the business and industrial life of Japan. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: The Sami, four lands, one people
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Hubert Schuurman
results.brief_description: There are 35,000 Sami who live in Norway, Sweden, Finland and the Soviet Union. Northern development is affecting their traditional way of life that had an economy based on reindeer-herding. The film shows how they are trying to find a way between old traditions and new development.

results.title: The Same old story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: A deceptively simple film, The Same Old Story is over almost before it has begun. A story within a story within a story, its effect is jarring, ambiguous and lingering. The film speaks of fear, which is as old as humanity and as new as today. An animated film in which reality and fantasy overlap dangerously.

results.title: The Salt marsh: a question of values
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Stanley Croner
results.brief_description: For the survival of humanity, we have to recognise the limits of our exploitation of natural systems. This film documents the value of the botanical communities that exist between sea and land. Emphasises the importance of energy flow and food supply in marshes and estuaries.

results.title: The Salmon industry of British Columbia
results.brief_description: The film opens with a map of the fishing grounds of the world, and the waters of British Columbia are selected to show details of the large-scale salmon industry. A study of this extremely active and resourceful fish in its natural surroundings is always fascinating, and this film combines a clear exposition of fishing by seine net, and the preparation of the fish for the cannery.

results.title: The Salmon
results.creator_credit: Max Munden Productions and Maxwell Munden
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
A summary of the salmon’s birth, run to the sea, and return, after a year or more to the river of its birth, is given, and we see the various stages described with underwater photography. A local angler shows the technique of catching the salmon by the fly fishing method in a river in Westmoreland.

results.title: The Salesman isn't dead, he's different
results.brief_description: Presents selling as a career. Points out the values and objectives of selling from view points of the men in the field and management. Shows the metamorphosis of the salesman from the slick talkers of half a century ago to the sophisticated account representative of today. Gives examples of what the successful modern salesman does, how he does it and his secondary responsibilities and benefits.
